details.content: CLICK HERE FOR EARLIER UPDATES

details.title: Major updates from Friday
details.content:
• Delhi sees highest single day spike of 2137 cases, total cases in national capital rise past 36,000
  • Maharashtra crosses 1 lakh cases College staff to attend office from June 17 in Odisha
  • Airborne transmission may be the dominant route of COVID-19 spread: Study
  • Urdu poet Gulzar Dehlvi dies days after recovering from COVID-19
  • Unlock 1.0: Buses, trucks can ply on highways amid '9 pm-5 am curfew', says Centre
  • Tamil Nadu sees 1982 more cases
  • MCD doctor's association calls for mass resignation over unpaid salaries
  • UP achieves target of 15,000 tests daily three days before deadline
  • Vehicle checks intensified on Chennai-Chengalpattu border, valid e-passes mandatory
  • No total lockdown in Chennai: TN govt

details.title: Madhya Pradesh's COVID-19 tally mounts to 10,443 with 202 new cases
details.content: The coronavirus case count in Madhya Pradesh grew to 10,443 on Friday with 202 new patients being detected, 70 of them in Bhopal, the health department said. Nine COVID-19 patients died during this period, taking the number of fatalities to 440 in the state, it said. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: MHA allows five categories of foreigners to enter India
details.content: Three months after banning foreigners from entering India due to coronavirus situation, the Centre on Friday lifted curbs on entry of five categories of foreign nationals to India--those who wish to come to the country on account of family emergencies and could not come due to the lockdown imposed to curb COVID-19. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Kerala's Guruvayur Temple closes from Saturday amid spike in COVID-19 cases
details.content: The Guruvayur Sree Krishna Temple in Thrissur district has decided to shut down from Saturday, with nearby areas of Chavakkad and Vadakkekad being declared as containment zones. The temple had opened for devotees on Tuesday and entry possible only through advance booking. However, with a spike in Covid cases in the Thrissur district, the temple administration decided to close the temple for devotees from Saturday.

details.title: True grit: 97-year-old man from Chennai wins battle against COVID-19
details.content: In a story of hope, a 97-year-old man has recovered from COVID-19 in a private hospital in Chennai, making him the oldest survivor of the virus in Tamil Nadu -- and the second oldest in the country. The nonagenarian, A Krishna Murti, was admitted to Kauvery Hospital on May 30 after testing positive for COVID-19. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: First Vande Bharat flight from Finland departs with 227 Indians
details.content: The first flight under Vande Bharat Mission from Finland departed on Thursday for New Delhi with 227 stranded Indians onboard. "#VandeBhaartMission flight AI 1184 & historic first passenger flight of @AirIndiaIn from Helsinki to New Delhi takes off with 227 pax incl senior citizens, stranded tourists, business visitors, students eager to join families," Indian embassy in Finland tweeted.

details.title: Contactless bell at Madhya Pradesh temple
details.content:
MP: A man, Nahru Khan has installed contactless bell at Pashupatinath Temple, Mandsaur. He says "We listen to azan, so I thought clanging of bells should also be heard. It works on proximity sensor (able to detect presence of nearby objects without physical contact)". #COVID19 pic.twitter.com/bjY13EqZk6

— ANI (@ANI) June 13, 2020

details.title: 97-year-old beats COVID-19 in Chennai
details.content:
Krishna Murti, a 97-year-old man was admitted at the hospital on May 30 after being tested positive for #COVID19. The patient was discharged after his test report was negative for COVID-19: Kauvery Hospital, Chennai (12/6) pic.twitter.com/jehhzvk3Sj

— ANI (@ANI) June 12, 2020

details.title: RPF takes robotics help to intensify the screening and surveillance
details.content:
Railway Protection Force, Pune yesterday launched Robotic Captain Arjun to intensify the screening & surveillance. This robot was launched to screen passengers while they board trains and keep a watch on anti-social elements: Central Railway #COVID19 pic.twitter.com/OUzh9kQ8Tn

— ANI (@ANI) June 12, 2020

details.title: Restaurants reopen in Shimla
details.content:
Himachal Pradesh: Restaurants and eateries reopened in Shimla yesterday following district administration's order to operate restaurants, dhabas and sweet shops at 60% of their seating capacity. pic.twitter.com/eTysHYoJOx

— ANI (@ANI) June 12, 2020

details.title: Idol makers in Indore face COVID-19 woes
details.content:
Madhya Pradesh: Idol makers in Indore say that they are facing hardships amid #COVID19 pandemic. An artist says, "we have incurred huge loss in last 2 months. We have started working now but raw material has become expensive. We haven't received any help from anyone." (12/6) pic.twitter.com/zn6YZrueej

— ANI (@ANI) June 12, 2020

details.title: Even Terracotta artisans not spared from lockdown woes
details.content:
Terracotta craftsmen in Gorkhapur say their business has slumped due to #COVID19 outbreak.A craftsman says,"lockdown has been partially lifted,but we haven't received any order. We are waiting for customers. We have a huge stock of products as it couldn't be sold due to lockdown" pic.twitter.com/ibOUojyxI6

— ANI UP (@ANINewsUP) June 12, 2020

details.title: DRDO's lending hand to Delhi cops
details.content:
Delhi: Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) has developed a sanitizing chamber named 'GermiKlean' to sanitise uniforms of security forces. The sanitizing chamber has been set up at Parliament Street Police Station. (12/6) pic.twitter.com/7xXyrhHyPr

— ANI (@ANI) June 12, 2020

details.title: Shops reopen in Indore
details.content:
Madhya Pradesh: Shops have reopened in Indore following relaxations in lockdown. A shopkeeper says, "we opened shops almost after 60-65 days. There is very less footfall in the market. All our savings have also exhausted." (12/6) pic.twitter.com/iCmOuh1Ptm

— ANI (@ANI) June 12, 2020

details.title: FIR against Maharashtra college
details.content: An FIR has been registered against a college in Talegaon Dabhade of Pune district for holding examination by calling students to the college amid lockdown.

details.title: Social distancing while offering Namaz
details.content:
Assam: Devotees offered Friday namaz at Burha Jame Masjid in Guwahati, earlier today. Imam of the mosque says,"Following Health Department's guidelines around 15 people offered prayers here while maintaining social distancing." pic.twitter.com/7kJquQCY2G

— ANI (@ANI) June 12, 2020

details.title: Update from Kerala
details.content: Guruvayur Sree Krishna Temple to be closed for devotees from 13 June, as nearby areas Chavakkad & Vadakkekad have been declared as containment zones. Weddings scheduled for tomorrow allowed; other wedding bookings, darshan passes stand cancelled: Guruvayur Devaswom, Trivandrum.

details.title: Latest Jharkhand numbers
details.content: 49 new COVID-19 positive cases and 55 people recovered and discharged in Jharkhand on Friday, no deaths reported in the state today. The total number of positive cases in the state stands at 1656, including 630 recovered and discharged & 8 deaths: Jharkhand government.

details.title: WATCH | Yamraj jumps in COVID-19 fight in J&K
details.content:
#WATCH Jammu & Kashmir: A local artist dressed up as Yamraj today and visited various markets of Udhampur city to create awareness among the people about #COVID19. He urged people to observe social distancing, wear mask and not come out of houses unnecessarily. pic.twitter.com/Gwl3jFVci1

— ANI (@ANI) June 12, 2020

details.title: Sculptors in Odisha's Puri faces hardships due to COVID-19
details.content:
Odisha: Sculptors in Puri facing hardship as tourism is down amid COVID19 pandemic. Rabi Sahu, Secy, Sudarshan Art&Crafts Village, says,“Handicraft business has suffered a great loss. Since last 3 months, artists are in a very difficult situation. Our survival is at stake” pic.twitter.com/guYOxYgUvx

— ANI (@ANI) June 12, 2020

details.title: Latest Uttarakhand numbers
details.content: 32 new COVID-19 positive cases and two deaths reported in Uttarakhand on Friday; 52 people recovered. The total number of positive cases in the state now stands at 1724, including 21 deaths and 947 discharged: Uttarakhand State Control Room COVID-19.

details.title: PM to meet CMs next week
details.content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will interact with CMs of 15 states/UTs on June 17 - Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu, Delhi, Gujarat, Rajasthan, Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, West Bengal, Karnataka, Bihar, Andhra Pradesh, Haryana, Jammu And Kashmir, Telangana and Odisha.

details.title: WATCH | Inside Delhi's Max Hospital's ICU that charges ₹53,000 per night for COVID-19 treatment
COVID-19 daily spike spike continues to grow bigger
details.content: India crosses THREE lakh mark as it reports the highest single-day spike of 11,458 new COVID-19 cases; total cases rise to 308993; 386 deaths in the last 24 hours. There are 145779 active cases, 154330 cured/discharged/migrated and 8884 deaths in the country so far: Ministry of Health.

details.title: New lockdown rules in Punjab's Ludhiana
details.content:
• On gazetted holidays, non-essentials shops to close at 5 pm and essential shops at 7 pm. Restaurants/liquor shops to close at 8 pm. Public movement continues till 9 pm.
  • On Sundays, only essential shops will open. Restaurants/liquor shops will close at 8 pm. Inter-district movement can continue without pass on weekdays but on weekends and gazetted holidays e-pass is needed.
  • In case of medical emergency or any other emergency, they can move without pass.
  • There's no restriction on movement of goods/ There is no restriction on movement within districts as of now.
  • E-pass is needed for weddings, names of all guests attending the wedding have to be mentioned in the pass.

details.title: Update from Tamil Nadu
details.content:
TN Health Department adds 81 Rapid Response Mobile Medical Teams to Chennai and neighbouring districts. The teams will hold fever camps and do early risk assessment in hotspots and give treatment to people needed at the earliest. @xpresstn @NewIndianXpress

— Omjasvin M D (@omjasvinMD) June 13, 2020

details.title: Update from Lucknow
details.content: Out of the 2220 samples tested yesterday for COVID-19, results of 71 are positive: King George's Medical University (KGMU), Lucknow

B/w manufacturing to metal finishing an item changes multiple hands. Alcohol based sanitiser deteriorates the quality. 'Suraksha 24' is chlorine-free, non-acidic. It keeps product safe from contamination without compromising with quality: R Sharma, General Manager MHSC. #COVID19 https://t.co/IOKyuEpBIj pic.twitter.com/VCBezBUQYg

— ANI UP (@ANINewsUP) June 13, 2020

details.content:
• Total positive: 1444.
  • New cases: 47.
  • Cured/discharged: 544.
  • Active Cases: 894.
  • Deaths: 6.

details.title: 2,000 nurses inducted for COVID-19 duties in Chennai
details.content:
TN government inducts 2,000 nurses in Chennai for #COVID19 duty. For a salary of 14,000 per month, their contract period is for six months while govt will take care of food and stay expenditures. @xpresstn @NewIndianXpress

— Omjasvin M D (@omjasvinMD) June 13, 2020

details.title: WATCH | Checking-in at star hotels will not be the same in post-COVID world
details.content:
Checking-in at star hotels will not be the same anymore! Guests will have to carry their luggage, undergo thermal scanning, hand sanitising, and even shoes and the luggage will be disinfected too.
Visuals from The Hilton, Chennai.

Express Video | @ashwinacharya05 @xpresstn pic.twitter.com/oydIMz7g4E

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) June 13, 2020

details.title: Sir Ganga Ram Hospital approaches Delhi High Court
details.content: Sir Ganga Ram Hospital, has approached Delhi High Court seeking quashing of FIR filed against the hospital by Delhi Police on complaint of Delhi Government for allegedly violating COVID-19 regulation. Delhi High Court to hear the matter on 15th June.

details.title: Deserted bus terminal in Ludhiana
details.content:
Bus terminal in Ludhiana remains deserted as Punjab Govt has barred inter-dist movement on weekends except for e-pass holders. A commuter says,"Govt should inform public 2-3 days before imposing lockdown to avoid inconvenience. I came to know about it only after reaching here". pic.twitter.com/3eyWJdm2uX

— ANI (@ANI) June 13, 2020

details.title: India-Bangladesh trade resumes after two months
details.content:
West Bengal: Trade between India-Bangladesh through Fulbari Integrated Check Post (ICP) resumes today. It was suspended on 23rd March in view of #CoronavirusPandemic. pic.twitter.com/RmzlB8i8Td

— ANI (@ANI) June 13, 2020

details.title: Two lakh to three lakh cases in ten days: India records its highest COVID-19 daily spike with 11,458 new infections
details.content: has now become the fourth worst-hit nation by the pandemic with a caseload of 3,08,993, according to coronavirus statistics website Worldometer. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Kejriwal government hits out at ICMR
details.content: If you want the number of tests conducted for COVID-19 to increase, then ask ICMR (Indian Council of Medical Research) to change its guidelines. We cannot flout ICMR guidelines that state certain conditions which are prerequisite for tests: Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain.

details.title: Breathless in Delhi: Ambulances with cylinder challenge for families, patients
details.content: Suffering from chronic kidney disease and diabetes, Miskeen Begum had lost consciousness in the morning and her 57-year-old husband had run the rounds of hospitals. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

#WATCH ...contract employees who made the video were motivated and did it on purpose. They have been suspended: Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain on video showing bad state of affairs in LNJP hospital pic.twitter.com/TyWgFByiac

— ANI (@ANI) June 13, 2020

details.title: Maharashtra government slashes charges for COVID-19 tests by private labs
details.content:
Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope on Saturday said that the government has reduced the rates of the COVID-19 tests conducted by private laboratories from Rs 4,500 to Rs 2,200.

Big relief those what to take the #COVID19 swab test. Maharashtra government reduced the #COVID19 swab testing cost in private lab. The home service testing facility cost reduced from Rs 5200 to Rs 2800 while testing at lab, reduced from Rs 4500 to Rs 2200. @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/epUZBNPBSm

— Sudhir Suryawanshi (@ss_suryawanshi) June 13, 2020
(READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Baby's day out at Tirupati hospital
details.content:
Baby's day out | Enjoying on its swing, a baby wearing a facemask was seen enjoying at a maternity hospital in Tirupati.

Express Photos | Madhav K@xpressandhra pic.twitter.com/4JFId20vEA

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) June 13, 2020

details.title: Corbett National Park will reopen tomorrow
details.content: Corbett National Park will reopen for public from tomorrow. People can visit Bijrani, Pakhro, Dhela and Jhirna zones while Dhikala zone will remain closed. Night stay at the park will remain prohibited till 15th November: Jai Raj, Principal Chief Conservator of Forests.

details.title: Migrant workers who returned from Mumbai get work in Karnataka village
details.content:
We were in quarantine for 15 days before getting work. It feels good to work again. How long will we sit at home? If we are being given work here, we will stay here otherwise we will have to go back to Mumbai: Amita, a migrant labourer in Kalaburagi's Ladchincholi village https://t.co/QZvx6lbIrn pic.twitter.com/bZvrx38BDr

— ANI (@ANI) June 13, 2020

details.title: Latest Rajasthan COVID-19 tally
details.content:
118 #COVID19 positive cases and 3 deaths reported in Rajasthan till 10:30 AM today; 164 people recovered and 177 discharged so far. The total number of positive cases in the state now stands at 12186, including 275 deaths, 9175 recovered & 8784 discharged: State health dept pic.twitter.com/JwrYUNdmMy

— ANI (@ANI) June 13, 2020

details.title: Social distancing norms flouted again in Rajasthan
details.content:
Rajasthan: Social distancing norms were flouted at a village council (panchayat) meeting held yesterday in Karauli district. #COVID19 pic.twitter.com/dw7fTJn91q

— ANI (@ANI) June 13, 2020

details.title: 222 fresh COVID-19 cases reported in Andhra Pradesh; two more deaths take toll to 82
details.content:
#CovidUpdates: Out of 14,477 #samples tested, from Friday 9 am to Saturday 9 am, 222 (186 from #AP, 33 from other states, 3 foreign returnees) tested positive in #AndhraPradesh; 2 deaths reported taking the toll to 82.@NewIndianXpress #APFightsCoronaVirus pic.twitter.com/aPEyt3pNTt

— TNIE Andhra Pradesh (@xpressandhra) June 13, 2020

details.title: Bhubaneswar reports three fresh cases of COVID-19, city tally reaches 106
details.content:
#COVID19 tally in #Bhubaneswar increases to 106 as three more test positive in the last 24 hours. Contact tracing is in progress. Primary contacts & neighbours of the patients have been quarantined and will be under surveillance for a week or two: @bmcbbsr @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/DmsFefltRN

— TNIE Odisha (@XpressOdisha) June 13, 2020

details.title: Five workers of same company among 13 new COVID-19 cases in Puducherry
details.content:
Five workers of a company in Puducherry's Mettupalayam industrial estate tested positive for COVID-19 along with eight other fresh cases.

(CLICK HERE TO READ FULL REPORT)

details.title: Former Pakistani all-rounder Shahid Afridi tests positive for COVID-19
details.content: I’ve been feeling unwell since Thursday; my body had been aching badly. I’ve been tested and unfortunately I’m covid positive. Need prayers for a speedy recovery, InshaAllah #COVID19 #pandemic #hopenotout #staysafe #stayhome— Shahid Afridi (@SAfridiOfficial) June 13, 2020

details.title: India to soon begin domestic production of Remdesivir drug to fight COVID-19
details.content:
India will soon start domestic production of anti-viral Remdesivir drug which will be for "restricted emergency use" on COVID-19 patients. 

(CLICK HERE FOR FULL REPORT)

details.title: All government offices in Tamil Nadu to be closed on second Saturdays and Sundays for disinfection works
details.content:
Disinfection work at the Secretariat campus in Chennai was carried out as per the government order which stated that all government offices will be closed on the second Saturday and Sunday to carry out disinfection work. Express Photo | @haisat2005 @xpresstn #COVID19 pic.twitter.com/7ABairJ0rc
